definitions.definition: To change the tone or pitch of the voice when speaking or singing.
definitions.example: The actress has a great skill of being able to inflect her voice to any situation.

definitions.definition: (grammar) To vary the form of a word to express tense, gender, number, mood, etc.
(grammar, of a word) To be varied in the form to express tense, gender, number, mood, etc.
definitions.example: In Latin, adjectives and nouns inflect a lot, but inflection is minimally found in Modern English.
No other poet has inflected me in style as much as Milton.

definitions.definition: (grammar) Changed in form to reflect function (referring to a word).

definitions.example: (An inflected language is one in which words change form when their function changes.)

definitions.definition: Bent or curved inward or downward
